Hey guys.

The series were made in 4 production blocks and labelled like 1ACV13-Fry_&_the_Slurm_Factory. When FOX aired them, they shuffled them into 5 seasons. 

1 and 2 seasons are nearly the same as 1 and 2 blocks, but 3, 4 and 5 are total mess, so several secondary storylines are crippled.

I prefer to rename the series in the production order and watch them, as planned by their creators. They know better then FOX bastards. I think, you'll agree with me ;) .

Apparently people seem to be having difficulties determining whether Futurama has 4 or 5 seasons.
Well here's the story:
Blame FOX, Futurama was created over 4 productions seasons, however FOX aired them over 5 television seasons. After Futurama was cancelled FOX also aired the 16 previously unseen episodes as "season 5". Thus creating this confusion.

Futurama in it's DVD -state is, and shall forever (most likely) be 4 seasons with the following layout.
Volume/Season 1 || 13 Episodes
Volume/Season 2 || 19 Episodes
Volume/Season 3 || 22 Episodes
Volume/Season 4 || 18 Episodes

If anyone is interested I'll be more than happy to share the names of all the episodes and their respective order. I don't have the energy to do it right now, but upon request will be happy to oblige
.
However there will be 4 episodic movies about Futurama with the following titles.

Futurama: Bender's Big Score
Futurama: The Beast with a Billion Backs
Futurama: Bender's Game
Futurama: The Wild Green Yonder

Like previously stated, they will be released in a episodic format with 4 episodes/movie.
